main_definition: Favourites are things, people or activities that one prefers, enjoys the most, or has a special liking towards.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In terms of food preferences, favourite refers to a type of dish or cuisine that someone particularly enjoys and often chooses when given options.
meanings_and_examples.example: Pizza is my favorite food. I eat it almost every week.

meanings_and_examples.definition: When discussing books, movies, songs, etc., a favourite refers to the item or piece of media that someone enjoys the most and often returns to repeatedly.
meanings_and_examples.example: My favourite book is 'To Kill a Mockingbird' by Harper Lee.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In personal relationships, favourites refer to people who are held in high regard or given special attention due to their importance or influence in one's life.
meanings_and_examples.example: My mother is my favourite person. She always knows how to make me feel better.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In terms of digital applications, favourites typically refer to a list or collection of items that users frequently access, often due to high preference or use.
meanings_and_examples.example: On my social media app, I have marked these photos as favorites because they are important to me.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In gaming and online platforms, favourite can refer to a user's chosen settings, modes of play, or content that is most suited to their preferences.
meanings_and_examples.example: My favorite mode in the game 'Fortnite' is casual because it allows me more time to enjoy the graphics.
